title: Understanding the Question
text: The 95% Critical Values of the Sample Correlation Coefficient Table can be used to determine whether the computed value of r, the sample correlation coefficient, is significant or not. Compare r to the appropriate critical value in the table. If r is not between the positive and negative critical values, then the correlation coefficient is significant. If r is significant, then you may want to use the line for prediction.

title: Degrees of Freedom
text: What are the degrees of freedom (df): n - 2, where n is the number of data points?

subHints.title: Finding n
subHints.text: What is n, the number of data points?

subHints.title: Solving for Degrees of Freedom
subHints.text: Plugging n $$=$$ 8 into the df equation, what is n - 2?

title: Critical Values
text: What positive and negative critical value is associated with df $$=$$ 6? Reference the 95% Critical Values of the Sample Correlation Coefficient Table.

title: r Significance
text: The critical values associated with df $$=$$ 6 are -0.707 and $$+0.707$$. Keep in mind that r $$=$$ -0.7204. If r < negative critical value or r > positive critical value, then r is significant. Is r significant?

title: Prediction
text: Since r $$=$$ -0.7204 and -0.7204 < -0.707, r is significant and the line may be used for prediction.
